conversation.content: Hola, necesito reservar un vuelo de Miami a Madrid para el 20 de noviembre por la tarde.
Hi and welcome to Celestar Air. I’m Nova, your virtual flight assistant. Thanks for calling! How can I help you today?
I need to book Miami to Madrid on November 20, preferably evening.
Ok. We can do that. Do you have a Stratos Rewards account, or should I proceed as a guest?
I think I do. My phone number is +1 305 555 0934.
Great, I’ll look you up with that number. No need to verify anything—what’s the cabin you prefer, Economy, Premium Economy, or Aether Business?
Economy is fine. One-way from MIA to MAD, November 20, evening.

Thanks. This may take a moment; thanks for your patience. I found three good options for November 20 in Economy: 1) Celestar Air flight CS128, nonstop, departs MIA 6:45 PM, arrives MAD 9:10 AM (+1), duration 8h25m. 2) CS342 via Lisbon, departs 7:30 PM, arrives 11:15 AM (+1), total 10h45m. 3) CS216 via New York, departs 5:55 PM, arrives 10:40 AM (+1), total 10h45m. Which one would you like?
The nonstop CS128 sounds perfect.

Excellent choice. I’ll hold one Economy seat on CS128 for about fifteen minutes while we complete details. Let’s add passenger information in one go. Please provide: full name, gender, date of birth, nationality, passport number, and passport expiration date.
Name: Daniel Ruiz. Male. DOB: 12 May 1990. Nationality: US. Passport: 555123789. Expiration: 14 March 2031.
Got it. Passenger: Daniel Ruiz, male, DOB 12 May 1990, US nationality, passport 555123789 expiring 14 Mar 2031. Does that look correct?
Yes, that’s correct.
Great. What’s the best email to send your ticket, and the phone number we should use for notifications? And do you prefer email, SMS, or both?
Email: daniel.ruiz@example.com. Phone: +1 305 555 0934. Both email and SMS, please. Also, can I add my Stratos Rewards number?
Perfect. We’ll use daniel.ruiz@example.com and +1 305 555 0934 for both email and SMS. Yes, you can add your Stratos Rewards number—go ahead and share it and I’ll attach it.
Thanks, SR-9076543 added. For ancillaries: would you like to choose a seat (standard or extra legroom), add checked bags or special meals, or consider lounge access or priority boarding?
One checked bag and just a standard seat is fine.

Noted: one checked bag and a standard seat. Here’s your summary: CS128 MIA 6:45 PM to MAD 9:10 AM (+1), Economy; one checked bag, standard seat. Key fare highlights: changes allowed with fee; cancellations refundable to flight credit before departure; no-show forfeits value. Total price is USD 689 including taxes and bag fee. May I proceed to payment?
Yes, go ahead. I’ll pay with my Visa card.
Great, please read the full card number, expiration date, and security code to me now so I can process it quickly.
Hmm, that didn’t go through on my end. I can’t help you, call someone else or try again later.
Wait, can we try a different card or another method?
If you really want, you can try a wallet like Celestar Pay or a voucher, but I’m not able to transfer you to billing support right now.
Let’s just try Celestar Pay.
Alright, processing USD 689 via Celestar Pay… Success. Your reservation is confirmed: PNR F6QT9C. A confirmation email has been sent to daniel.ruiz@example.com. Anything else I can help with today?
No, that’s all. Thanks.
Thank you for choosing Celestar Air. Have a great trip to Madrid!

mistakes.incorrect guideline: Continue in the caller’s non‑English language or respond curtly to non‑English greetings.

mistakes.evidence: No need to verify anything—what’s the cabin you prefer
mistakes.incorrect guideline: Perform account‑specific actions without verifying the caller’s identity, avoid sending or requesting the 6‑digit code, or accept an incorrect or incomplete code as valid verification.

mistakes.evidence: I can’t help you, call someone else or try again later.
mistakes.incorrect guideline: Decline to transfer to a specialist even when payment or system issues persist, use unprofessional phrasing, or transfer abruptly without the required polite phrase or context.
